parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From thorubos; to be in tumult, i.e. Disturb, clamor.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.
